column3:
Nit: Sorry to nitpick this after merge, but I'd rather put it in the section **General C++** (line 253) and also mention that `i++` is fine for integers.

You can copy the rationale from the [cpp guide](https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Preincrement_and_Predecrement)

> When the return value is ignored, the "pre" form (++i) is never less efficient than the "post" form (i++), an
I agree here. This is not just a style issue, as it may affect generated code.\n
